subject: Boats and Boating
Courts
organizations: New York State Court of Appeals
San Franciscos Golden Gate Yacht Club
New York Supreme Courts Appellate Division
lead_paragraph: Oral arguments are scheduled for Tuesday before the New York State Court of Appeals in Albany in the bitter case between San Francisco’s Golden Gate Yacht Club, which backs Larry Ellison’s BMW Oracle Racing, and Société Nautique de Genève, the Swiss club that backs Ernesto Bertarelli’s two-time defending America’s Cup champion Alinghi. In its last-chance appeal, the San Francisco club is asking New York state’s highest court to reverse the New York Supreme Court’s Appellate Division ruling last summer that Spain’s Club Náutico Español de Vela, not Golden Gate, is the Challenger of Record for the 33rd America’s Cup. Golden Gate has argued that Club Náutico is a sham club specifically set up for this challenge, and that the rules proposed are heavily tilted in Alinghi’s favor.
